articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Taegwan Glass Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Taegwan Glass Factory 
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Taegwan Glass Factory. 
					 He looked round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room dedicated to the history of the factory. 
					
					 He said the Taegwan Glass Factory is the factory honored with the visit paid by leader Kim Jong Il and the one always in his mind. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats performed by the workers of the factory, recalling that they have upheld the party's policy with shining successes in production for the past more than three decades. 
					
					 He learned about the performance of the optical measuring instruments newly produced by the factory. 
					
					 Seeing the instruments working, he said they were very excellent and they were impeccable in any aspect. 
					
					 He went round the newly built plating production process of the factory. 
					
					 Watching with deep attention the automatic plating on computerized four assembly lines, he was pleased that the workers were completely freed from harmful labor and they were doing a cheerful work. 
					
					 He gave the factory an instruction on putting all production processes from designing to processing and assembling on an automatic basis by focusing sustained efforts on the technological updating of all production processes just as it did the plating process. 
					
					 Underscoring the need to successfully build a hostel and dinning hall so that the workers may work and lead a cultural and emotional life without any inconvenience, he took a benevolent measure. 
					
					 He watched a performance given by the itinerant art squad of the factory. 
					
					 He praised it for giving a truthful and appealing performance representing the feelings of the workers of the factory before having a photo taken with the performers. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the party members and other workers of the factory would achieve bigger successes in the development of Juche-oriented and modern new products and production. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon and Hong Yong Chil.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Gymnasiums, Stadiums in Chongchun Street, Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Gymnasiums, Stadiums in Chongchun Street, Pyongyang Indoor Stadium
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent best sports apparatuses and equipment to gymnasiums and stadiums in Chongchun Street and the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium which have been successfully remodeled as comprehensive sports cultural bases.
					 Modern sports apparatuses and equipment make it possible to lay the firm material and technological foundations for successfully carrying out the plan of the Workers' Party for building a sports power and provide players and other people with services for games, training and mass sports at a higher stage.
					
					 A ceremony for conveying the gifts was held at the Weightlifting Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Monday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials of different units of the sports field, players, coaches and employees.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Songdowon International Children's Camp
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to Songdowon International Children's Camp
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent sports apparatuses and facilities to the Songdowon International Children's Camp, another moving story about the love of the Workers' Party of Korea for the children.
					 He made sure that the world's best camp was built for children and sent articles for cultural use and kitchen utensils for cooking practice to it recently. And he repeatedly showed profound loving care for campers so that nothing was insufficient.
					
					 A ceremony for conveying the gifts took place at the camp on Monday. 
					
					 Present there were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials and teachers of the camp and campers.
					
					 At the ceremony speakers said that the gifts sent by Kim Jong Un to the camp this time reflect his deep trust and great expectation to see the children stoutly growing to be reliable reserves of the Songun revolution, knowledgeable, virtuous and health,  who would shoulder upon themselves the future of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 Representing the unanimous wishes of the schoolchildren and their parents and teachers across the country, they extended deepest thanks to Kim Jong Un who has brought only happiness to the children and makes the song "We are the happiest in the world" resound forth. They called on the campers to become genuine juvenile revolutionaries who deeply trust and follow Kim Jong Un only who steadfastly carries forward the love of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the younger generation and future, and true personifiers of Kim Jong Il's patriotism which means profound love for the country and its people.

articles.title: Congratulations to South African President
articles.content:
Congratulations to South African President
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma on his reelection as president of South Africa.
					 The message said that the results of the recent general election in South Africa clearly manifested the deep trust and expectation of the South African people for the president and the African National Congress of South Africa.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president fresh, greater success in his future work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Chinese Starts Tour of Hoeryong in DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Starts Tour of Hoeryong in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The tour of Hoeryong City in North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK by Chinese is to begin on May 27.
					 Hoeryong is the birthplace of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					
					 This one-day tour by bus was agreed by the DPRK's Chilbosan Travel Company and China's Longjin City People's Government.
					
					 The first batch will consist of more than 130 tourists, and it will mark an occasion in encouraging border tourism in the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Help Korean Farmers in Chongjin City
articles.content:
Chinese Help Korean Farmers in Chongjin City
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Members of the Chinese consulate general in Chongjin City of the DPRK and Chinese residents in the city Sunday did friendship work at the Jikha Co-op Farm in Chongam District of the city.
					 They looked round the room devoted to the history of the farm, which tells about the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's feats for the country's agricultural growth and the farm's development under the care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They did weeding in a potato field of the farm to help its peasants and enjoyed a performance given by its art group during a break.
					
					 They offered aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Vietnamese Military Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Vietnamese Military Delegation Arrives
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Department for Military Training of the General Staff of the Vietnam People's Army headed by Lieutenant General Nguyen Duc Than arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Chief of Asia-Pacific Regional Office of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Here
articles.content:
Chief of Asia-Pacific Regional Office of Int'l Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies Here
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Chapagain Jagannath, chief of the Asia-Pacific Regional Office of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and his party arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Korean in Russia Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean in Russia Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, a Korean in Russia, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday.
					 She laid a bouquet before the statues before paying tribute to them.
					
					 Jong also laid a bouquet before the bust of the anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on the same day.

articles.title: Korean in Russia Arrives
articles.content:
Korean in Russia Arrives
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Jong Il Sim, a Korean in Russia, arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Boxers Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Boxers Back Home
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK boxers returned home after taking part in the international boxing tournament named after Konstantin Korotkov held in Khabarovsk, Russia.
					 They bagged a gold medal and three bronze medals at the tournament. It brought together ace boxers from 16 countries and regions.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned greeted the boxers at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Monday.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai and staff members of his embassy did a friendship work at the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Cooperative Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, on Monday.
					 They helped agricultural workers in rice-transplanting.
					
					 The ambassador expressed belief that the farm would have a rich harvest this year when a national conference of subworkteam leaders in the agricultural sector of the DPRK took place.
					
					 Staff members of the embassy handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Rason Sanctuary in DPRK Draws Global Ornithologists
articles.content:
Rason Sanctuary in DPRK Draws Global Ornithologists
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Rason Migratory Bird Reserve in a northern area of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea draws attention of global ornithologists.
					 This sanctuary, covering an area of 32 square kilometers, consists of Man, Tongbon and Sobon lagoons in the area of Rason and Al Islet on the East Sea of Korea, eight kilometers away from the area.
					
					 The area has good conditions for ecological environment and Man and Sobon lagoons, in particular, are fit for the standards the world set as marshland for migratory birds.
					
					 The Rason reserve, one of 30-odd sanctuaries for migratory birds in the country, has been listed as an IUCN reserve. And its registration as a reserve of RAMSAR, an international body, is now under discussion.
					
					 The reserve serves as a main habitat of migratory birds flying in the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 At least 200 species of sea birds have been observed in the area up to now. 
					
					 The recent field survey, made by ornithologists of different countries, shows that a large number of bird species on the way to extinction inhabit the area, with more than 40 000 migratory birds observed in around Man and Sobon lagoons close to the sea.
					
					 Among them are Anas Formosa, Coturnix japonica, Numenius madagascariensis, Grus vipio, Grus monacha, Cygnus olor, Ans falcate, Larus relictus, Emberiza yessoensis, Calidris tenuirostris, Clangula hyemalis, which have been listed as birds to be protected worldwide.
					
					 The reserve is of weight significance in preserving the ecological diversity.

articles.title: Ancient Tomb with Murals Discovered in DPRK
articles.content:
Ancient Tomb with Murals Discovered in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Archaeological Institute of the DPRK Academy of Social Sciences has recently discovered a tomb with mural paintings, which dates back to the Koguryo Dynasty (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					 The tomb is located at the southern foot of Mt. Kwangdae in Honam-ri, Samsok District, Pyongyang. Around it there are several Koguryo tombs registered as world cultural heritage.
					
					 As a typical Koguryo-style earthen tomb, it consists of passages and a stone chamber, which is rectangular-shaped from south to north and has two biers on the floor.
					
					 Fox-red lines are seen in the mural painting on the walls of the tomb's inside passage. And some part of the picture of four guardians, painted with red, green, fox-red, black and other colors, remain on the four walls of its chamber.
					
					 What is noteworthy in the tomb murals is a star picture on the chamber ceiling, from which big fox-red stars are believed to represent Jupiter and Mercury when referring to the then astronomical chart.
					
					 The said tomb is estimated to have been built in the sixth century, for its structural style and mural paintings.
					
					 It will be of great help in studying Koguryo's cultural development, architecture, pictorial art and astronomical level.

articles.title: DPRK Concentrates Efforts on Rice-transplanting
articles.content:
DPRK Concentrates Efforts on Rice-transplanting
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- All the people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have turned out in assisting farming, including rice-transplanting.
					 Thanks to the energetic efforts of those helpers and peasants, farm fields throughout the country are turning green with each passing day.
					
					 U Myong Chol, chairman of the management board of the Ryongsan Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 Many officials and workers came to the farm to help peasants in doing farm.
					
					 Encouraged by their assistance, we, peasants, will do our best in the ongoing rice-transplantation campaign with the responsibility for the country's granary.
					
					 Such practices could be seen in a farm near the biggest hotspot on the West Sea of Korea. A large number of servicepersons were transplanting rice on paddy fields there.
					
					 Jang Chol Hyon, an officer of the Korean People's Army, said:
					
					 We, servicepersons, are helping the farmers while keeping our full readiness to destroy any provocation of the south Korean military at once.
					
					 Choe Kum Gyong, an official of the Sosong District, Pyongyang City, People's Committee, said on a farm field in Kangnam County:
					
					 Many workers and officials of the district came to this farm to finish the rice-transplanting in time, aware that agriculture is an outpost in the struggle for defending socialism.
					
					 No force can break the DPRK people's will to build a socialist thriving nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Urged to Lift Confrontation Measure
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Urged to Lift Confrontation Measure
						
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- A south Korean opposition party on May 23 issued a statement demanding the puppet regime lift "the May 24 measure".
					 The statement recalled that four years have passed since the regime took the above-said measure with the warship Cheonan incident as an occasion. It went on:
					
					 Pursuant to the measure, south Korea completely suspended exchange and cooperation between the north and south of Korea including the inter-Korean trade, south Koreans' visits to the north.
					
					 However, Park Geun Hye is insisting on the "doctrine of gaining a great opportunity of unification" only.
					
					 We once again emphasize that the formation of what the Park regime calls a "committee for getting ready for unification" is not a priority task but it is the most urgent to boost the inter-Korean exchange through total lifting of the above-said measure.
					
					 The statement urged the Park to lift the measure at once and resume the long-stalled tour of Mt. Kumgang at an early date and put the inter-Korean economic cooperation and relations on a normal track.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Press Censorship Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Press Censorship Flayed 
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- 137 media scholars of south Korea issued a joint statement denouncing the authorities' press censorship, according to south Korean CBS.
					 They accused Chongwadae of interfering in KBS's activities to bar it from broadcasting a true story about the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 They held that the press censorship and the adhesion of power and media dating back to the period of the erstwhile military regime have been revived.
					
					 Chongwadae was behind the KBS case, they noted, demanding the present regime clarify its stand on this and punish those involved in it.
					
					 They urged the president of KBS to make an apology to the people and resign and the "National Assembly" to opt for a thoroughgoing probe into the truth and start a state investigation into the case.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Christian Presbyterian Church of south Korea in a commentary on May 23 demanded an investigation into the regime's unreasonable interference such as Chongwadae's control over the KBS.
					
					 Noting that KBS has lost its fairness, public nature and independence, the organization urged the regime to clarify the truth about the press censorship and immediately put in custody and investigate the KBS president.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown upon Teachers Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Crackdown upon Teachers Protested
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea held a press conference on May 22 in protest against the puppet authorities' crackdown upon teachers, according to south Korean CBS.
					 The organization criticized the Ministry of Education for seeking to take disciplinary steps against teachers of the Union staging actions, asserting that Park Geun Hye is to blame for the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 This is an act of denying Park's responsibility and one for blocking the anti-"government" struggle of teachers, it noted.
					
					 The organization demanded the authorities stop at once the crackdown.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's "Talk to People" Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's "Talk to People" Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People in an editorial on May 20 denounced Park Geun Hye's "talk to the people."
					 Park in the talk on May 19 referred to the responsibility for failing to properly cope with the ferry Sewol disaster, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 No people can understand why it takes more than one month to reach such a reasonable understanding.
					
					 A bigger problem is that far from making a sincere reflection, Park shifted the blame on to her inferiors, signaling a self-righteous policy administration.
					
					 In the final analysis, this only brought to light Park's political intention to mislead the public opinion and conduct the upcoming election by setting forth a shocking plan.
					
					 What the people want at present is neither unilateral "government" reorganization nor the revision of a criminal law.
					
					 Park will be disqualified if the people's expectation is persistently dashed as now.

articles.title: Worst Right to Work in S. Korea Deplored
articles.content:
Worst Right to Work in S. Korea Deplored
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on May 22 carried an editorial titled "Dishonor of the worst right to work in the world".
					 The editorial recalled that an international labor organization listed the level of the right to work in south Korea as the worst one in the world on May 19, adding it is shameful, indeed.
					
					 The workers in south Korea are not guaranteed three rights to work and the "government's" and businesses' unfair and unreasonable infringement upon the right to work are rampant in the society, it said.
					
					 A specific example of it is that the registration of the Government Employees Union is denied, a decision was made to label the Teachers Union an illegal union and unionists who participated in strikes are suppressed, it added.
					
					 The editorial demanded the "government" discard its wrong understanding of the right to work.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Tajikistan
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- The Tajik committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Dushanbe on May 21. 
					 Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, was elected chairman of the committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: British Organization Supports S. Koreans in Their Struggle for Independence, Democracy and Reunification
articles.content:
British Organization Supports S. Koreans in Their Struggle for Independence, Democracy and Reunification
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- We extend full support to the south Korean people in their struggle to wipe out the fascist group of Park Geun Hye, drive the U.S. imperialist Yankees, the sworn enemies of the Korean people, out of south Korea and achieve independence, democracy and reunification. 
					 The Britain-Korea Friendship Association said this in a statement on May 17 on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising in south Korea. 
					
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising was a heroic one to realize the desire for independence, democracy and reunification against the U.S. colonial rule over south Korea and the military fascist dictatorship of the puppet authorities, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The uprising recorded a proud page in the history of the south Korean people's struggle for independence, democracy and reunification. 
					
					 Courage and devotion displayed by the uprisers greatly inspired a lot of people in the world struggling against neocolonialism and dictatorship. 
					
					 Their heroic self-sacrifice is always remembered by resistants and people and deals a heavy blow to the enemies. 
					
					 The uprising proved that independence and social change can never be achieved in a peaceful way and counterrevolutionary violence should be met with revolutionary violence.
					
					 We pay high respect to the heroic fighting spirit of the uprisers on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of the uprising.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked in Thailand, Guinea
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked in Thailand, Guinea 
 Pyongyang, May 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Thailand and Guinea to mark the 50th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 A seminar was held at Rajabat Pranakorn University of Thailand and a lecture and reading session at the combined fleet command of the Navy of Guinea and the construction site No.1 in Conakry City between May 13 and 18. 
					
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand in his speech said that the start of Kim Jong Il's work at the Central Committee of the WPK is of great significance in the history of the party. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea and the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and led the WPK to the victory with the Songun politics, the chairman said, adding:
					
					 We will fully support the just cause of the Korean people, shouting hurrah of the Songun idea. 
					
					 The chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association said the revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il will shine long with the WPK. 
					
					 The captain of the escort ship of the president of the combined fleet command of the Navy of Guinea said the history of Kim Jong Il's leadership over the WPK is the immortal history in which he performed great exploits for the Korean nation and humankind with his outstanding political ability.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Fabrica de Vidrio de Taegwan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Fabrica de Vidrio de Taegwan
 Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Vidrio de Taegwan.
					 Recorriendo la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la de presentacion del historial, el Mariscal dijo que esta fabrica inolvidable para si mismo tiene relacion significante con el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Aprecio los meritos de los obreros de la fabrica quienes apoyaron al Partido con muchos exitos productivos durante mas de 30 anos ultimos.
					
					 Y averiguo la eficiencia de los aparatos opticos de medida que se producen nuevamente en la fabrica.
					
					 Tras manejarlos, dijo que los aparatos de esta fabrica son muy excelentes y perfectos.
					
					 Luego, el Mariscal recorrio el nuevo proceso de galvanizacion recien acondicionado en la fabrica.
					
					 Al observar con atencion el trabajo automatico de galvanizacion en 4 lineas segun el control de computadora, se puso alegre diciendo que los obreros fueron liberados de los trabajos nocivos y estos se cambiaron en un trabajo confortable.
					
					 Instruyo concentrar las fuerzas en la renovacion tecnica del proceso general de produccion para automatizar todos los procesos inclusive el diseno, la elaboracion y el montaje de los productos, como lo hicieron en el proceso de galvanizacion.
					
					 Y subrayo que se debe edificar bien el albergue y el comedor para que los trabajadores de la fabrica trabajen y disfruten de una vida cultural sin ninguna incomodidad y tomo las medidas beneficiosas para el respecto.
					
					 Ese dia, el Mariscal presencio la funcion del grupo de agitacion artistica movil de la fabrica.
					
					 Tras evaluar a quienes dieron la funcion sincera y agitadora reflejando tal como es el alma de los obreros de la fabrica, se fotografio junto con ellos.
					
					 El Mariscal expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los miembros partidistas y obreros de la fabrica lograran mayores exitos en el desarrollo y la fabricacion de nuevos productos autoctonos y modernos.
					
					 Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Yun Tong Hyon, Pak Jong Chon y Hong Yong Chil.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia equipos e instalaciones deportivos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia equipos e instalaciones deportivos
 Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio los equipos e instalaciones deportivos modernos a los centros y estadios de la Avenida Chongchun, remodelados con excelencia como integral base deportiva y cultural, y al Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang, gracias a lo cual, se ha consolidado mas la base material y tecnica para realizar el proyecto del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de construir la potencia deportiva y asegurado en el nivel mas alto a los jugadores y trabajadores la condicion de la competencia, los ejercicios y el servicio de deporte masivo.
					 La ceremonia de entrega tuvo lugar el dia 26 en el Centro de Levantamiento de Pesas de la Avenida Chongchun con la participacion del secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae, el ministro de Deportes Kim Yong Hun y otros funcionarios, los deportistas, entrenadores y empleados.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia equipos deportivos y avios a Campamento de Songdowon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia equipos deportivos y avios a Campamento de Songdowon
 Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio los equipos deportivos y avios al Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon.
					 El hizo remodelarlo como campamento de talla mundial y hace poco envio articulos de uso cultural y utensilios para practica culinaria y esta vez, los envio otra vez.
					
					 La ceremonia de entrega tuvo lugar el dia 26 en el campamento con la participacion del jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Il Hwan, y otros funcionarios, empleados y campistas del campamento.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente sudafricano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente sudafricano
 Pyongyang, 26 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion a Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma con motivo de su reeleccion como presidente de la Republica Sudafricana.
					 El remitente senala que el resultado de las elecciones generales efectuadas en el pais africano es una prueba contundente de la alta confianza y esperanza que deposita el pueblo sudafricano en el destinatario y el Congreso Nacional Africano de Sudafrica.
					
					 Convencido de que en el futuro tambien se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran de continuo las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Sudafrica, hizo votos por los nuevos y mayores exitos en las futuras labores del destinatario por el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad del pais.
